data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person who is facing forward must always face forward and must return to the starting point. If the instructions tell you to take a 9, 9, 10 and 9, you must take them twice in order to return to where they start. So, the answer is Yes.

The directions say you need to get back to start. You have to turn around and right turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

Take the same number of steps as the number in the previous instructions to see how far you've come. You return to the starting point with 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You do not return to the starting point after 1 step. You take 7 steps back to begin the next step. So, the answer is Yes.

You can always move in the same direction as you walked the first few times. So, the answer is yes.

There are five ways to approach from the same starting point. When facing backward, the order of steps is always forwards and backwards. Moving forward is a way of progress. So, the answer is No.

When making a trip to a destination, always always face forward. Remember, you always have to end at the same start point. Final answer: Yes.

The sentence in sentence 1 is different than the sentence 2 because you are moving from left to right. Usually, you would take one step forward when you are going left. Also, you would take 6 steps left if you were going right. Thus, the answer is No.

The second step back is facing the starting point when you are 4 steps left. The third step forward is facing you once you have taken 3 steps forward. To return to the starting point you have to take 1 step. So, the answer is Yes.
